description: Our nation is in the midst of an unprecedented investment in IT to support healthcare delivery. The centerpiece of the 2009 Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health (HITECH) Act is 30 billion dollars in incentives for doctors and hospitals to become meaningful users of electronic health records. The hope is that EHRs will enable better management of information in order to improve the quality and reduce the cost of health care.
title: The Impact of Electronic Health Records on Ambulatory Costs
